ai-mil5.2.2:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.2.2:1.2_0: ‘There is no such question, Ānanda, when the Realized One answers them again.’
ai-mil5.2.2:1.3_0: That’s how this question can be seen and heard to subtle, without making anything left over.

ai-mil5.2.2:1.5_0: ‘No, Ānanda, there is no place for the Realized One.’
ai-mil5.2.2:1.6_0: The Realized One has not declared these things by memories, by the Realized One,
ai-mil5.2.2:1.7_0: this question too should be expelled by a each question.”
ai-mil5.2.2:2.1_0: “Great king, this wasn’t worth a sixteenth part of the Buddha’s instructions, and not answering in the questions of the Realized One. But he couldn’t ask it about his question.
ai-mil5.2.2:2.2_0: There are, great king, these four questions.
ai-mil5.2.2:2.4_0: There is a question that should be answered definitively. There is a question that should be answered analytically. There is a question that should be set aside.
ai-mil5.2.2:3.1_0: What is the definitive answer to that should be answered?
ai-mil5.2.2:3.6_0: ‘Consciousness’ is impermanent. This is the definitively.
ai-mil5.2.2:4.1_0: What is a question that should be answered?
ai-mil5.2.2:4.6_0: ‘This consciousness should be answered analytically.’ This is the answer to analytically.
ai-mil5.2.2:5.2_0: ‘What is the all that should be answered with the eye?’
ai-mil5.2.2:6.6_0: ‘The cosmos is both finite and infinite.’
ai-mil5.2.2:6.7_0: ‘The world is neither finite nor infinite.’
ai-mil5.2.2:6.8_0: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing’ ...
ai-mil5.2.2:6.9_0: ‘The soul and the body are different things’.
ai-mil5.2.2:6.11_0: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’.
ai-mil5.2.2:6.12_0: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ ...
ai-mil5.2.2:6.13_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
